physical_appearance: The image shows a black-and-white photograph. It is rectangular in shape. The photograph depicts five construction workers engaged in labour. They have shovels in their hands and some of them adorn hats. The foreground of the photograph captures metallic railings and structures of a building. The metal beams are aligned in a zig-zag orientation.
sgcool_label_text: This photograph was taken by Singaporean photographer Tan Lip Seng. Tan is arguably the most important photographer in the region developing colour derivative and photo montage techniques. Many of the artist's works have won numerous awards internationally and show a strong graphic and stylistic sensibility. Tan spent 42 years as a medical photographer at the National University of Singapore.
creator_1: Tan, Lip Seng, 1942- Tan, Lip Seng
subject_terms_1: gelatin silver prints construction workers industrial structures construction (assembling)
subject_terms_2: Prints Black-and-white photography Construction workers Industrial buildings
